item.title: My First AutoTalker(almost undetectable) Updated 1.1
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

When you close the script, it continues the script. And you didnâ€™t free the form which results in memory leaks. Put in FreeForm(frmDesign); right after SafeShowFormModal;

To put in WaitTime and HowMany into your form, just make a new form with the 5 messages, an edit box for WaitTime and an edit box for HowMany.

Read full topic

item.title: My First AutoTalker(almost undetectable) Updated 1.1
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Nice job JunkJ, but try to code with standards. Also, Iâ€™m pretty sure your HowManyTimes feature did not work because it didnâ€™t use the integer HowMany accurately.

Here is a slightly better version, try to use this as an example for your future scripts.

Btw, if you are only using 1 or 2 or even 3 of SRLâ€™s functions, just copy and paste them into your script, and give credit. This way, it doesnâ€™t take a year just to load the script.

{.Script Info:
# ScriptName  =AutoTalker
# Author      =wickedboy141
# Description =types anything and you can choose how slow and how many times
# Comments    =This is my first auto talker plz report any bugs
/Script Info}
////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
//                                                                    //
//               please set up lines from 18 to 21                    //
//                                                                    //
////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
program AutoTalker;

var
  HowMany :integer;

const
  Message1 = 'msg1'; // what you want to type
  Message2 = 'msg2'; // what you want to type
  Message3 = 'msg3'; // what you want to type
  Waits = 3000;  // how long your want to wait till typing the message again
                 // 1000=1sec 2000=2sec...... recommanded 3000 for runescape
  HowManyTimes = 1; // how many times you want it to say

{*******************************************************************************
procedure TypeByte(k: Byte);
By: Mutant Squirrle
Description: Types one char.
*******************************************************************************}
procedure TypeByte(k: Byte);
begin
  KeyDown(k);
  wait(10 + Random(50));
  KeyUp(k);
end;

{*******************************************************************************
procedure TypeSend(Text: String);
By: Mutant Squirrle
Description: Types text humanlike using random timeing on keys.
*******************************************************************************}
procedure TypeSend(Text: String);
var
  i: Integer;
begin
  for i := 1 to Length(Text) do
  begin
    TypeByte(GetKeyCode(Text[i]));
    Wait(50 + Random(120));
  end;
  Wait(200 + Random(500));
  TypeByte(13);
end;

procedure Talker;
begin
  TypeSend(Message1);
  Wait(Waits+Random(500));
  Wait(800);
  TypeSend(Message2);
  Wait(Waits+Random(500));
  Wait(800);
  TypeSend(Message3);
  Wait(Waits+Random(500));
  HowMany := HowMany + 1;
end;

procedure Author;
begin
  WriteLn('This script was written by wickedboy141');
  Wait(500);
  WriteLn('Thank you for using my script');
end;

begin
  ClearDebug;
  Activateclient;
  ClearDebug;
  repeat
    Talker;
  until(HowMany = HowManyTimes)or(IsFKeyDown(12))
  if(HowMany = HowManyTimes)then
    Author;
  WriteLn('finished talking!!');
end.

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: My First AutoTalker(almost undetectable) Updated 1.1
item.dc:creator: @junkj junkj
item.description:
@junkj wrote:

I fixed a few stuff in the main loop i used a diffrent var you spelled message wrong and
Some other stuffâ€¦here it is

[code]{.Script Info:

ScriptName =AutoTalker

Author =wickedboy141

Description =types anything and you can choose how slow and how many times

Comments =This is my first auto talker plz report any bugs

/Script Info}
////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
// //
// please set up lines from 18 to 21 //
// //
////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
program AutoTalker;
{.include srl/srl.scar}

var
howmany :integer;

const
message1=â€˜aâ€™;//wht u want to type
message2=â€˜bâ€™;//wht u want to type
message3=â€˜câ€™;//wht u want to type
waits=3000;// how long your want to wait till typing the message again
// 1000=1sec 2000=2secâ€¦ recommanded 3000 for runescape
howmanytimes=1; //how many times you want it to say

procedure talker;
begin
typesend(message1);
wait(waits+random(500));
wait(800);
typesend(message2);
wait(waits+random(500));
wait(800);
typesend(message3);
wait(waits+random(500));
howmany:=howmanytimes+1
end;

procedure author;
begin
writeln(â€˜this script was written by wickedboy141â€™);
wait(500)
writeln(â€˜thank you for using my scriptâ€™);
end;

begin
SetupSRL;
Activateclient;
cleardebug;
repeat
talker;
until(howmanytimes=howmanytimes)
if(howmanytimes=howmanytimes)then
author;
writeln('finished talking!! ');
end.
[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: My First AutoTalker(almost undetectable) Updated 1.1
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

for i := 1 to HowManyRepeats do
begin
talker;
end;
cleardebug;
writeln(â€˜finished talking!! :)â€™);

That wonâ€™t work. Use:

for i := 1 to HowManyRepeats do
begin
begin
talker;
end;
cleardebug;
writeln(â€˜finished talking!! :)â€™);
end;

Read full topic

item.title: My First AutoTalker(almost undetectable) Updated 1.1
item.dc:creator: @wickedboy141 wickedboy141
item.description:
@wickedboy141 wrote:

hey ppl,
I just updated my autotalker, and now it has forms!!! and you can
type up to 5 messages!!!
Sorry for not updating for a long time but i had exams
so now i will be on moparscape a lil often, trying to learn to make scripts and
be happy when u ppl tell me that i am a noob and show me my mistakes!!!

open to criticism,works for runescape,very undetectable,

please try it out, you can also set the amount of time between each message and also can set how many times to talk
Edited: now it can type 3 messages
please tell me anything that is need to improve

[code]
{.Script Info:

ScriptName =AutoTalker

Author =wickedboy141

Description =types anything and you can choose how slow and how many times

Comments =This is my first auto talker plz report any bugs

version =1.1

/Script Info}
////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
// //
// please set up lines from 31 to 33 //
// //
////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
program AutoTalker;
{.include srl/srl.scar}

var
frmDesign : TForm;
GroupBox1 : TGroupBox;
Label1 : TLabel;
Label2 : TLabel;
Label3 : TLabel;
Label4 : TLabel;
Label5 : TLabel;
Edit1 : TEdit;
Edit2 : TEdit;
Edit3 : TEdit;
Edit4 : TEdit;
Edit5 : TEdit;
Button1 : TButton;
i : integer;

Const waittime=300;//how long you want to wait between the messages
//1000=1 sec
howmany=2; //How many times do you want to type the messages?

procedure ButtonClick(sender: TObject);
begin
WriteLn(â€˜Starting Script!!â€™);
frmDesign.Caption:= frmDesign.Caption + â€˜.â€™;
frmDesign.ModalResult:= mrOk;
end;

procedure InitForm;
begin

frmDesign := CreateForm;
frmDesign.Left := 262;
frmDesign.Top := 104;
frmDesign.Width := 400;
frmDesign.Height := 395;
frmDesign.Caption := â€˜Wickedboy141â€™â€˜s Autotalkerâ€™;
frmDesign.Color := clBtnFace;
frmDesign.Font.Color := clWindowText;
frmDesign.Font.Height := -11;
frmDesign.Font.Name := â€˜MS Sans Serifâ€™;
frmDesign.Font.Style := [];
frmDesign.Visible := False;
frmDesign.PixelsPerInch := 96;
GroupBox1 := TGroupBox.Create(frmDesign);
GroupBox1.Parent := frmDesign;
GroupBox1.Left := 30;
GroupBox1.Top := 26;
GroupBox1.Width := 271;
GroupBox1.Height := 262;
GroupBox1.Caption := â€˜Messagesâ€™;
GroupBox1.Color := clBlue;
GroupBox1.ParentColor := False;
GroupBox1.TabOrder := 0;
Label1 := TLabel.Create(GroupBox1);
Label1.Parent := GroupBox1;
Label1.Left := 52;
Label1.Top := 25;
Label1.Width := 55;
Label1.Height := 13;
Label1.Caption := 'Message : ';
Label2 := TLabel.Create(GroupBox1);
Label2.Parent := GroupBox1;
Label2.Left := 52;
Label2.Top := 67;
Label2.Width := 52;
Label2.Height := 13;
Label2.Caption := â€˜Message :â€™;
Label3 := TLabel.Create(GroupBox1);
Label3.Parent := GroupBox1;
Label3.Left := 52;
Label3.Top := 113;
Label3.Width := 52;
Label3.Height := 13;
Label3.Caption := â€˜Message :â€™;
Label4 := TLabel.Create(GroupBox1);
Label4.Parent := GroupBox1;
Label4.Left := 52;
Label4.Top := 158;
Label4.Width := 52;
Label4.Height := 13;
Label4.Caption := â€˜Message :â€™;
Label5 := TLabel.Create(GroupBox1);
Label5.Parent := GroupBox1;
Label5.Left := 52;
Label5.Top := 202;
Label5.Width := 52;
Label5.Height := 13;
Label5.Caption := â€˜Message :â€™;
Edit1 := TEdit.Create(GroupBox1);
Edit1.Parent := GroupBox1;
Edit1.Left := 127;
Edit1.Top := 21;
Edit1.Width := 121;
Edit1.Height := 21;
Edit1.TabOrder := 0;
Edit2 := TEdit.Create(GroupBox1);
Edit2.Parent := GroupBox1;
Edit2.Left := 127;
Edit2.Top := 63;
Edit2.Width := 121;
Edit2.Height := 21;
Edit2.TabOrder := 1;
Edit3 := TEdit.Create(GroupBox1);
Edit3.Parent := GroupBox1;
Edit3.Left := 127;
Edit3.Top := 110;
Edit3.Width := 121;
Edit3.Height := 21;
Edit3.TabOrder := 2;
Edit4 := TEdit.Create(GroupBox1);
Edit4.Parent := GroupBox1;
Edit4.Left := 127;
Edit4.Top := 153;
Edit4.Width := 121;
Edit4.Height := 21;
Edit4.TabOrder := 3;
Edit5 := TEdit.Create(GroupBox1);
Edit5.Parent := GroupBox1;
Edit5.Left := 127;
Edit5.Top := 199;
Edit5.Width := 121;
Edit5.Height := 21;
Edit5.TabOrder := 4;
Button1 := TButton.Create(frmDesign);
Button1.Parent := frmDesign;
Button1.OnClick := @ButtonClick;
Button1.Left := 187;
Button1.Top := 317;
Button1.Width := 75;
Button1.Height := 25;
Button1.Caption := â€˜Start!â€™;
Button1.TabOrder := 1;
end;

procedure SafeInitForm;
var
v: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(â€˜InitFormâ€™, v);
end;

procedure ShowFormModal;
begin
frmDesign.ShowModal;
end;

procedure SafeShowFormModal;
var
v: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(â€˜ShowFormModalâ€™, v);
end;

procedure talker;
begin
wait(800);
typesend(Edit1.text);
wait(waittime+random(500));
wait(800);
typesend(Edit2.Text);
wait(waittime+random(500));
wait(800);
typesend(Edit3.text);
wait(waittime+random(500));
wait(800);
typesend(Edit4.text);
wait(waittime+random(500));
wait(800);
typesend(Edit5.text);
wait(waittime+random(500));
end;

procedure author;
begin
writeln(â€˜this script was written by wickedboy141â€™);
wait(500);
writeln(â€˜thank you for using my scriptâ€™);
wait(2000)
end;

begin
SetupSRL;
SafeInitForm;
SafeShowFormModal;
FreeForm(frmDesign);
wait(500);
cleardebug;
author;
Activateclient;
begin
for i := 1 to howmany do
talker;
end;
end.[/code][br][size=1]Posted on: January 05, 2007, 11:58:57 PM[/size][hr]

So please call me a noob and show me my mistakes or what i can improve
